skill.name: Psionics
entries: Psionik ist eine neue auf Intelligenz basierende Fertigkeit, die dazu dient, Dinge psionischer Natur zu verstehen, so wie Arcana Dinge arkaner Natur verstehen kann. Es ist eine Fertigkeit, die dir hilft, psionische Objekte, Phänomene und Kreaturen zu identifizieren.

default: {@item leather armor|phb} or (b) a {@item scale mail|phb} (if proficient)
(a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

entries: Ein riesiger Ork fliegt durch den Raum, zerschlägt Tische und Stühle, bevor er mit einem donnernden Aufprall gegen die Wand prallt und benommen zusammenbricht. Ein Mensch, dessen Augen noch immer mit unheimlicher Kraft glühen, wirft ein paar zusätzliche Münzen auf die Theke. "Tut mir leid für die Unordnung. Wenn er wieder aufwacht, sag ihm, er soll sich das nächste Mal mit jemandem in seiner Größe anlegen."

Der Gesichtsausdruck des Gefangenen wechselt von trotzig zu verwirrt, als der Vernehmungsbeamte keine Fragen stellt, sondern ihn nur schweigend anstarrt. Seine verwirrte Miene wird besorgt, als er sich unwillkürlich daran erinnert, wo er die Beute versteckt hat. "Unter den Ställen hinter dem Gasthaus Rusty Hook", sagt der Vernehmer schließlich, während der Dieb einen erschrockenen Gesichtsausdruck bekommt.

"Ist dir nicht... kalt oder so?", fragt der Zwerg die Elfe, während sie durch den Schnee stapfen, und mustert ihr einfaches Gewand und ihre nackten Füße. "Ich denke einfach, dass es warm ist", antwortet die Elfe mit einem verwirrten Gesichtsausdruck. Der Zwerg schnaubt, ein Hauch von kalter Luft. Typischer Elfenblödsinn. Nur... dass sie noch nicht erfroren sind. "Sagt mal... könntet ihr euch etwas 'Warmes' in diese Richtung denken?", fragt der Zwerg hoffnungsvoll. Zur Überraschung des Zwerges verschwindet die Kälte des Schnees völlig. "Das ist ja geradezu gruselig... hey, hör jetzt nicht auf! Ich wollte nur sagen, dass es gruselig ist."

Psionen sind Menschen, die eine besondere jenseitige Kraft angezapft haben und in der Lage sind, die Macht ihres Geistes zu nutzen, um unmögliche Leistungen zu vollbringen. Sie können Gedanken lesen, riesige Gewichte heben und körperliche Grenzen überwinden und erwecken damit gleichermaßen Ehrfurcht und Schrecken.

Die genaue Natur der psionischen Macht kann eine Frage sein, die in deinem Setting beantwortet wird, oder auch nicht. Die meisten sehen psionische Macht als etwas, das von innen kommt, obwohl es auch andere Antworten gibt - von der durchsickernden Macht der jenseitigen Reiche über einen alternativen Weg, Magie auszudrücken, bis hin zur Verwirklichung des Willens eines Individuums in der Welt.

entries.name: Powerful Minds
entries: Da die Waffe eines Psions sein Geist ist, ist er immer nur einen unbedachten Gedanken davon entfernt, seine Mitmenschen zu verletzen. Für einen Psion kann die Grenze zwischen Denken und Handeln sehr schmal sein, was ihn dazu zwingt, seine Gedanken und Emotionen unter Kontrolle zu halten, damit seine Kräfte nicht Amok laufen. Dies führt dazu, dass viele von ihnen seltsame Verhaltensweisen oder Manierismen entwickeln, die ihnen helfen, ihren Geisteszustand zu kontrollieren, und die einem außenstehenden Beobachter oft recht exzentrisch erscheinen.

Überlege dir, wie dein Psion seine Kräfte unter Kontrolle hält und wie stark sich seine Kräfte auf sein Alltagsleben auswirken. Wie sich das Lesen von Gedanken auf ihre Körpersprache oder ihre Gewohnheiten auswirken kann. Legt er bequem von seinem Schlafsack aus Holz für das Lagerfeuer nach oder hält er sich zurück, um seine Macht nicht für triviale Dinge zu nutzen, damit er keinen Fehler macht?

entries.name: Misunderstood Power
entries: In a world of widespread magic, many will assume a psion to be a type of Sorcerer or Wizard, mistaking their powers for the common applications of magic. The common villager keeps only one mental category for the supernatural and creepy people that bend reality to their will. But even among magic users, a psion's powers will frequently be found unnerving.

It is often those who do understand magic that find a psion's abilities the most aberrant. A force that intersects the magical weave rather than obeys it, the nature of the power that the psion wields one can only contemplate with unease.

entries.name: Psionics & Magic
entries: The mechanical interactions between magic and psionics are covered in the Psionics feature, but may vary depending on your GM and setting. Psionics are still an expression of the supernatural, and may still be affected by effects that suppress magical effects, but are often mysterious and baffling to those familiar with magic, being a more raw interaction of the mind and weave.

entries.name: Psion
Creating a Psion
entries: Wenn du einen Psion erschaffst, überlege dir den Hintergrund deines Charakters. Wie bist du ein Psion geworden? Wurdest du mit latenten Kräften geboren? Oder ist dir etwas passiert, das dir deine Kräfte verliehen hat? Oder hast du dich absichtlich durch strenge mentale Übungen trainiert, um sie zu nutzen? Überlege, wie sich die Entwicklung einer seltenen und geheimnisvollen Kraft auf deine Interaktionen mit anderen Menschen ausgewirkt hätte.

Überlegt euch, was ihr mit euren neuen Kräften bezwecken wollt, oder wie ihr sie einsetzen wollt. Willst du für einen Zauberer gehalten werden, der Magie wirkt, oder willst du offen sagen, dass du ein... anderer Mensch bist?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: Du kannst schnell einen Psion erschaffen, wenn du die folgenden Vorschläge befolgst. Erstens, wähle Intelligenz als höchsten Fähigkeitswert, gefolgt von Geschicklichkeit oder Konstitution. Zweitens: Wähle einen Hintergrund, der sich für Intelligenz-Fertigkeiten eignet.
Ich hatte nicht vor, ihn zu töten! Er hat mich nur wütend gemacht, und ich habe mir vorgestellt, ihn zu schubsen.

Psionen haben eine tiefe Quelle roher, ungezähmter Macht in sich. Sie kämpfen unablässig darum, ihre Kraft zu bändigen und zu konzentrieren. Eine einfache Ablenkung von ihrer Konzentration kann katastrophale Folgen haben.

Der ständige innere Kampf eines Psions kann dazu führen, dass Psions seltsame Macken oder Gewohnheiten entwickeln, die sie unbeabsichtigt entwickelt haben, um ihre Kräfte unter Kontrolle zu halten. Abenteurer-Psions suchen oft nach Möglichkeiten, ihre Kräfte zu trainieren und zu verfeinern, ohne den Menschen in ihrer Umgebung übermäßigen Schaden zuzufügen. Ein Psion, der keine Möglichkeiten findet, einen Teil seiner Kräfte zu nutzen, gleicht einem Pulverfass, das jederzeit explodieren kann.

Einen Psion-Charakter zu spielen, ist eine Gelegenheit, eine seltsame oder ungewöhnliche Persönlichkeit zu spielen. Um deinen Psion-Charakter zu unterscheiden, solltest du die Optionen in den folgenden Abschnitten in Betracht ziehen.

entries.name: Social Quirk
entries: Welche Eigenart haben Sie entwickelt, um sich selbst davor zu bewahren, anderen ungewollt zu schaden? Wie hilft Ihnen das, Ihre Macht zu kontrollieren?

entries.caption: Social Quirk
rows: Amüsiert. Du kannst schnell lachen und findest Humor in Situationen, die sonst niemand lustig findet. Du bist in der Lage, über angespannte Situationen zu lachen, die die meisten Menschen zum Ausrasten bringen würden.

Distanziert. Andere könnten zu Ihnen hinüberschauen und sehen, wie Sie in die Ferne starren. Sie schauen nicht wirklich auf etwas, sondern flüchten nach innen und entfernen sich geistig weit von den Reizen der Außenwelt.

leidenschaftlich. Sie haben eine ungewöhnliche Liebe, die Sie häufig in Gesprächen erwähnen und der Sie Ihre Freizeit widmen. Das können alte Kupfermünzen, Knöpfe oder Jadefiguren sein, aber Sie finden sie viel faszinierender als jeder andere.

Erschreckend. Es macht dir Spaß, andere zu erschrecken und zu verängstigen. Es kann sein, dass du wie ein Hund direkt neben dem Ohr von jemandem zu bellen anfängst oder kurz in Wut gerätst, nur um eine Minute später wieder zu lachen. Du neigst dazu, jeden, der dich nicht kennt, in Unruhe zu versetzen.

Verblendung. Deine Wahrnehmung der Realität unterscheidet sich von der aller anderen. Vielleicht denkst du, dass du ein Baum bist, der sich lediglich als Elf manifestiert hat, als er erwachte, oder vielleicht denkst du, dass alle deine Freunde nur psychische Manifestationen sind, die du erschaffen hast.

Liebevoll. Du vergötterst jeden, den du triffst, und überschüttest ihn mit großen Zuneigungsbekundungen. Du benimmst dich mehr wie ein Welpe als alles andere, und andere können nicht anders, als sich von deiner ansteckenden Freude anstecken zu lassen.

entries.name: Origins
entries: Psionische Kräfte sind ungewöhnlich und seltsam, ein Nebeneffekt der Wechselwirkung zwischen der materiellen Dimension und dem Fernen Reich.
Finde heraus, wie dein Charakter seine psionischen Kräfte erlangt hat, und überlege, wie sich dieser Ursprung auf die Hintergrundgeschichte und die Entwicklung deines Charakters auswirken würde.

entries.caption: Origins
rows: Du wurdest mit deinen Kräften geboren, und niemand weiß, warum. Niemand sonst in deiner Umgebung hatte irgendwelche psionischen Kräfte. Deine Kräfte wurden von deiner Familie gefürchtet, und du hast deine Kindheit damit verbracht, deine Kräfte unter Kontrolle zu halten.
Du bist irgendwie in die Astralebene abgedriftet, während du geträumt hast, und als du aufgewacht bist, hattest du diese neuen Kräfte.

Du hast deinen Geist studiert und trainiert, bis du in der Lage warst, seine Macht auf die Welt um dich herum auszuüben. Es war ein langer, schwieriger Weg, aber nach vielen Jahren zahlte sich dein Training aus.
Du gehörst zu einer besonderen Gruppe oder Rasse, die von Natur aus psionische Kräfte entwickelt, wenn sie aufwächst, also hattest du viel Hilfe bei der Entwicklung deiner Kräfte.

Du bist einem Wesen begegnet, das du nicht hättest treffen sollen, aber deine Erinnerung daran ist verzerrt und vage. Die Begegnung hat dir psionische Kräfte verliehen, dich aber auch ein bisschen verrückt gemacht.

Du bist an einen weit entfernten Ort gereist, wo psionische Kräfte nicht ungewöhnlich sind. Dort hast du bei psionischen Meistern studiert, die dich ausgebildet und dir geholfen haben, deine psionischen Talente zu verbessern.

spell.name: Compelled Query
entries: You focus your telepathic powers on a creature and ask it a simple question. It must make an Intelligence saving throw, or it conjures a short mental thought or image that answers your question to the best of its ability that you can perceive telepathically. A creature gains a +5 to the saving throw against this spell for each time it has been used on them in the past 24 hours.

spell.name: Delve Mind
entries: You delve into a creature's mind, forcing it to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, for the duration or until you end the spell you gain access to its memories from the past 12 hours, and are able to recall things it remembers as if they are your own memories, but these memories contain only things the target creature remembers.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can delve an additional 12 hours further back in the creature's memories for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flicker

time.condition: which you take when you would take damage

entries: You flicker between the material and ethereal plane. Until the start of your next turn, each time you would take damage, including the triggering attack, roll a {@dice 1d4|d4}. On a 2, you gain resistance to that instance of damage. On a 4, you don't take any damage.

spell.name: Future Insight
entries: Your roll {@dice 3d4} or {@dice 1d12} (your choice) and record the results. During the duration, you can expend one of these dice to add or subtract them from any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by a creature within 60 feet of you until the dice are exhausted or the spell ends. You must expend the die after the roll is made, but before you know the outcome of the roll.

spell.name: Glimpse the Future
entries: You give a creature within range a glimpse of their future. Roll a {@dice d4} to determine the outcome:

rows: The target foresees an action to come. Roll a {@dice d20} and record the value. Until the duration of the spell ends, they can replace one of their d20 rolls with the value rolled.

The target sees their own death. If they are reduced to zero hit points by an attack or failing a save throw during the duration, they instead evade the attack or pass the saving throw if they are not otherwise incapacitated prior to being reduced to zero.
They see a future victory, growing confident. They gain 10 temporary hit points and are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition for the duration of the spell.

The target sees an ambush or surprise, the first time they would be surprised they are not, or the first time an attack would be made against them with advantage, it is instead made with disadvantage.

entries.name: The Unavoidable Death
entries: In the case of number 2, passing the save will not always be enough to make them not be reduced to zero hit points. Sometimes they are reduced to zero by something like falling damage that has no save or attack. Sometimes life's a bummer that way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using 3 or more psi points, you can select the effect instead of rolling a {@dice d4}

spell.name: Inner World
entries: As an action, you create and enter an imaginary world. All other creatures within 120 feet are pulled this world with you. This world is centered on you, and extends in 120 feet in all directions.

A creature that reaches the edge of this world can make a Charisma saving throw to attempt to exit, spending 5 feet of movement to return where they were before being pulled into the world on success, and being unable to move out the world until the start of their next turn on failure. A creature outside the world can attempt to enter it by moving to where you cast the spell (which is marked by a glowing psionic rift) and making a Charisma saving throw to enter the world. You can allow a creature to automatically pass their save to enter or exit the world.

When you create this world, you can create obstacles and terrain of your choice, creating walls, pillars, and other obstacles that take up to twenty 5 by 5 square foot areas (stylistically, these can appear however you choose). These can be placed consecutively or spread out in any method of your choosing, but any area with a creature must contain a path that creature can fit through to both you and the edge of the of the world.

You can additionally create up to five hazardous spaces on the ground that are 5 foot squares. These can be fires, spikes, biting mouthes, or whatever you choose, but regardless of its form if a creature takes {@damage 4d4 + 4} psychic damage when it enters the effect's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. Each of these hazards must be at least 20 feet from another hazard.

While in this inner world, if you fail saving throw, you choose to succeed instead. You can do up to 3 times during the duration of the spell. All spells and powers have their psi point cost reduced by one.

During the spell, as an action, you can attempt to destroy a creature within the world. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On failure, it takes {@damage 8d8 + 8} psychic damage and is removed from the imaginary world, returning to where they were before being pulled into it.
The world can be brightly or dimly lit, and you control the weather within it.
When the spell ends, you and any creature that remains in the world exit the world returning to space you entered the world from.
Quickly Constructed Worlds

The casting time of this spell is 1 action, which is 6 seconds in game. It is recommended that that you come up with a general layout and any resources needed for this spell in collaboration with your GM when you select the spell, and make at most minor changes to the world when casting it.

spell.name: Invested Competency
entries: You touch a willing creature imbuing psionic competency into them. Until the spell ends, they gain expertise in on skill of your choice, adding double their proficiency bonus to that skill.

spell.name: Invest Life
entries: You sacrifice some of your health to mend another creature's injuries. You take {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, and one creature of your choice that you can see within range regains a number of hit points equal to twice the necrotic damage you take.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Launch Object
entries: Choose one object weighing 1 to 5 pounds within range that isn't being worn or carried. The object flies in a straight line up to 90 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping early if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, the object and what it strikes each take {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum weight of objects that you can target with this spell increases by 5 pounds, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d8}, for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mind Blast
entries: You emit a blast of psychic energy. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn on a failed save. A creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned} on a successful save.

spell.name: Nullify Effect

time.condition: which you take when you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw

entries: You gain advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws (Including the triggering save) until the start of your next turn. You also gain resistance to Psychic and Force damage until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can roll an additional {@dice d20} as part of your advantage roll. If you cast this at the 5th level or higher, it grants immunity to Psychic and Force damage for the duration.

spell.name: Psychic Drain
entries: You draw on the psychic energy of another creature you can see to sustain yourself. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure it takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage and you gain temporary hit points equal to half the amount of psychic damage dealt and regain one expended psi point.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell deals an extra {@damage 1d8} psychic damage.

spell.name: Shockwave
entries: You unleash a burst of telekinetic force in all directions. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you is knocked 5 feet back and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} damage bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Terrifying Visions
entries: You instill a vision of terrifying hallucinations into the mind of a target you can see. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, it takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and must immediately use its reaction to move to move it's movement speed directly away from you. This movement does not force the creature to move into any hazard or take movements that cause it to take damage (such as jumping off a cliff or moving into a spell effect). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't forced to move.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Turbulent Warp
entries: You teleport yourself to an unoccupied space you can see within range, leaving behind a spatial distortion. Each creature within 10 feet of the space you left must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, they take {@damage 5d4} force damage and are teleported to an empty space of your choice within 5 feet of where they were. On success they take half as much damage and are not teleported.

You can also teleport one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell, and there must be an unoccupied space within 5 feet of your destination space for the creature to appear in; otherwise, the creature is left behind.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Unlocked Potential
entries: You unlock the potential of a creature's mind, allowing it to fully reach its limits. For the duration, once per turn the creature can add {@dice 1d4} to any attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw it makes. Each time it adds the extra {@dice 1d4}, it takes 1 psychic damage as it pushes beyond its natural limitations.

feat.name: Psionic Mind

feature: The ability to use at least one {@filter psionic discipline|optionalfeatures|feature type=PsiD}

entries: You tap deeper into your psionic potential drawing out a new talent. You can select a psionic talent from the Psion class psionic talent list. You can't select a talent you already know, or one that requires a level restriction, even if you are already of that level.

feat.name: Psionic Adept
entries: You develop a minor grasp of psionic power, either uncovering an innate potential within yourself, through contact with a psionic source, or through training. You gain one of the {@filter psionic disciplines|optionalfeatures|feature type=PsiD} of the Psion class, gaining the attached psionic feature and psionic power, but you do not gain use of any associated spells when gain a Discipline from this feat. You gain 1 psi point that you can use to empower the Discipline. You regain use of this psi point when you complete a short or long rest.

feat.name: Inner Power

feature: At least 1 psi or ki point

entries: Your body is powered by the inner powers that course through it. Your maximum psi or ki points (if you have both, your choice of which) increases by 1. At the end of your turn after expending one or more psi or ki points during your turn (not counting temporary or free points, such as those from Psionic Mastery), you heal for a number of hit points equal to the psi or ki points spent.

feat.name: War Psion

feature: The ability to use at least one {@filter psionic discipline|optionalfeatures|feature type=PsiD}

entries: You have mastered utilizing psionics in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a psionic ability when you take damage.
You can perform the somatic components of psionic abilities even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to use a psionic disciplines power or spell targeting the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Psionic Synthesis

feature: 2 or more {@filter psionic disciplines|optionalfeatures|feature type=PsiD} known

entries: You gain the ability to meld your Psionic abilities together to produce potent new effects. When you select this feat, you can select one fusion talent for free. You can only select fusion talents when you have all the Disciplines in their prerequisite

monster.name: Psi Crystal
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Psi Familiar
entries: Der Psi-Kristall hat die gleichen mentalen Fähigkeiten wie sein Beschwörer.

optionalfeature.name: Adaptive Hunter
entries: After using your {@optfeature Mind Leech|ktp} on a target, you can gain one skill, tool or language proficiency that creature has until the end of your next long rest. If you use this ability again, you lose the last proficiency or language to acquire the new one.

optionalfeature.name: Animated Projections
entries: As an action, you can project a swarm of etheral objects. You can expend 5 psi points to cast {@spell dancing objects (animate object)|kibblestasty:KCC}. When cast in this way, the spell creates new etheral objects rather than animating existing ones.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Arms
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 psi point to create psionic constructions serving as additional appendages. These arms last for 10 minutes. You determine the arms' appearance, and they vanish early if you are incapacitated or die. You can use the astral arms to make unarmed strikes. The unarmed strikes you make with the arms use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls. If you hit with one of them, you deal force damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

When you create them, or by spending 1 psi point as a bonus action while they are manifested, you can make a single unarmed strike with these arms as a bonus action. You can use Psionic Mastery points on this.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Construct
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}
{@bold Casting Time:} 1 Aktion
{@bold Range:} 60 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Konzentration, bis zu 1 Minute

You project an ethereal creation from your mind taking the shape of a medium or smaller creature, weapon, or other object. This creation is clearly ethereal in nature. When you create it, and on subsequent turns using your action to mentally control it, you can move it up to 30 feet in any direction and attack; so long as it does not move beyond the range of the power. To attack with it, make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage. If the Astral Construct moves out of range of the spell, it fades away into nothing, ending the spell.

Während das Astralkonstrukt aktiv ist, kannst du Psi-Punkte bis zur Höhe deines Einsatzlimits ausgeben, um Befehle zu erteilen, die dein Konstrukt beeinflussen und ihm Kraft verleihen. Die Befehle erfordern keine Aktion, aber du kannst dein Psi-Punkte-Limit für die insgesamt erteilten Befehle nicht überschreiten, und jeder Befehl kann nur einmal pro Runde erteilt werden.

{@bold Grab} {@italic (1 psi point)}: Can only be used while your construct is Solidified. A target creature within 5 feet of your construct that is no more than one size larger than the construct must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the construct. At the end of each of the restrained creature's turns it can repeat the saving throw. The condition ends if the construct becomes ethereal again, or becomes more than one size smaller than the target.

{@bold Grow} {@italic (1 psi point)}: Your construct increases by one size, and its number of damage dice increases by one. It returns to its normal size at the start of your next turn. It can only gain one additional die (for example, up to {@dice 2d8}).
{@bold Relocate} {@italic (1 psi point)}: The construct disappears and reappears anywhere within 60 feet of you.

{@bold Replicate} {@italic (3 psi points)}: You use Relocate, but the original doesn't disappear. Until the end of your turn, you have another construct and control both with the same action (commands only affect one of your choice). Pick one construct to fade at the start of your next turn or use Sustain.

{@bold Solidify} {@italic (1 psi point)}: Your construct becomes solid, blocking its space until the start of your next turn. You can only use this command if it is not an occupied space. It has an armor class of 16, and hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier + your Psion level. The construct becomes ethereal again if it drops to zero hit points.
{@bold Strike} {@italic (2 psi points)}: The construct makes an attack (even if it has already attacked)

{@bold Sustain} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: At the start of your turn, you can sustain the effect of a Solidify, Grow or Replicate command for an additional round. An effect that has been replicated can be sustained across all replicated constructs with a single use, but each effect can only be sustained once per turn (for example, you can never sustain more than one replicated construct). This costs 1 psi point for each effect sustained. Sustaining Solidify refreshes the construct's hit points to its maximum.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Rift - Fusion Talent

feature: Psionic Synthesis, Transposition, Projection, Astral Swap

entries: As a bonus action, you can Phase Rift to where your Astral Construct is; this movement counts as a Phase Rift, and you can apply modifiers to it as normal. Your Astral Construct is moved to where you started this movement along the Phase Rift; during the movement you can command your Astral Construct to attack a creature it passes with its action.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Swap
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 psi point to swap places with your Astral Construct.

optionalfeature.name: Attuned Argument
entries: Your telepathic insight allows to adapt and tailor your influence on others. When you make a Charisma check, after you roll but before you know the outcome, you can choose to roll an additional d20 and take the higher result. You can do this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all uses on a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Sight
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 psi point to psionically see the aura of a creature of your choice within 30 feet. When you see the creature's aura in this way, you can determine if there are any spells or magical effects affecting the creature, and you learn their schools of magic, if any. You can also determine if the creature is under the influence of psionics. A shapeshifter or creature that is transformed or disguised by magical or nonmagical means must make a Charisma (Deception) check against your Psionics save DC. On a failure, you can perceive their original form in their aura.

optionalfeature.name: Awaken Mind
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell awaken|phb} without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Beam of Annihilation
entries: You gain the ability to cast a {@spell beam of annihilation|KibblesTasty:CC} for 6 psi points. If you have a specialization of Psychokinesis, you can only select the related elemental damage type, but the beam's damage ignores resistance to that damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Body Control
entries: You gain the ability to use your {@spell alter self|phb} ability at-will without expending psi points. Additionally, you can cast {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} on yourself for half the psi point cost it would normally cost.

optionalfeature.name: Consumed Strength
entries: You can use your Intelligence modifier in place of Strength for Athletics check while you have a psionic charge from Mind Leech. Additionally, targets you are grappling have disadvantage on the saving throw against your Mind Leech power.

optionalfeature.name: Consuming Link
entries: You can target a creature that is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by you with Mind Leech as long as they are within 120 feet. You do not need to be able to see the target when targeting them in this way and the target has disadvantage on the saving throw against Mind Leech.

optionalfeature.name: Consumption Discipline
entries: Your psychic powers are that of a predator, and your prey is the minds of others. Their thoughts, their feelings, their vital psionic energies are your food.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@optfeature Adaptive Hunter|ktp}
{@optfeature Mind Leech|ktp}

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Consumption psionic discipline you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at a level equal to the psi points spent.

entries.name: Available Talents
entries: {@optfeature Consumed Strength|ktp}
{@optfeature Consuming Link|ktp}
{@optfeature Skill Thief|ktp}
{@optfeature Unlife Wielder|ktp}

optionalfeature.name: Controlled Power
entries: You gain the ability to suppress the glow and somatic component of your psionic powers. You can expend 2 psi points to use a power without a visual sign or somatic component. Each time you use this talent, the cost of doing so doubles until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Deadspot
entries: You gain the ability to expend 8 psi points to cast {@spell antimagic field}. Once you cast it this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Denial
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}
{@bold Casting Time:} 1 Aktion
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Unmittelbar

You release a burst of raw psionic nullification at a creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On failure, it takes 1d4 force damage as its existence is disrupted.

If the target is an aberration, celestial, construct, elemental, fey, fiend, undead, or a creature with the ability to cast spells or use psionic powers, it takes an extra {@damage 1d4} force damage, and becomes disoriented; until the end of its next turn, it rolls a d4 and subtracts the number rolled from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as its Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration. A creature can choose to fail the saving throw.

You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to Denial modifying its functionality (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power.

{@bold Aura of} {@italic (3 psi points)}: Instead of targeting a creature, the power becomes an effect around you with a radius of 20 feet until the start of your next turn; any creature of your choice that enters or starts its turn in the area of effect must make a saving throw against the power.
{@bold Existential} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: You deal an additional {@damage 1d4} initial and bonus (if applicable) force damage to the target creature on a failed save.
{@bold Firm} {@italic (2 psi points)}: The target creature has disadvantage on the saving throw against this ability.
{@bold Lingering} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: You can apply the effect of Disruptive Touch to an affected creature.

{@bold Supernatural} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: A supernatural effect of or on the creature is ended; if the effect is a magical or psionic power, it is only ended if the psi points spent on this modifier equals or exceeds the spell level or psi points spent on the effect.

If the property is an innate property of a creature (either of the target creature, or affecting the target of this power), it is only ended if the psi points exceed the CR (or class levels) of the target creature, and they return at the end of that creature's next turn. The supernatural effect can't be its existence, unless it has less than 10 hit points and it would otherwise qualify.

optionalfeature.name: Disruptive Touch
entries: When you gain this feature, you can create an aura of interference, wreathing yourself in the disruptive power that asserts reality. You can end minor magical or psionic effects (such as the result of cantrips or zero point psionic powers) by touching them, and have resistance to illusions or magical damage from things you touch (gaining advantage on the saving throw against them, if applicable).

If you are grappling or otherwise touching a spellcasting or psionic creature, at the start of your turn you can expend 1 or more psi to interfere with their abilities until the start of your next turn. In order to cast a spell or use a psionic power, they must succeed on a saving throw of their spellcasting or psionic ability score against your psionics DC, unless they are casting a spell with a higher level or using a power with more psi points than the psi points spent on this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Divided Mind
entries: You learn the {@spell divide self|KibblesTasty:CC} spell, can cast it by expending 5 psi points. When you gain access to the Innate Psionics feature, you may expend a use of Innate Psionics to cast {@spell divide self|KibblesTasty:CC} at the level of the use of Innate Psionics expended. For example, if you choose the {@spell teleport|phb} spell for your Innate Psionics feature at 13th level, you could expend a casting of {@spell teleport|phb} to instead cast {@spell divide self|KibblesTasty:CC} as a 7th-level spell, and can't cast {@spell teleport|phb} or {@spell divide self|KibblesTasty:CC} as a 7th-level spell in this way until you finish a long rest.
You do not require the material components of the spell when you cast it by expending psi points or a use of Innate Psionics.

optionalfeature.name: Dreamwalker
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell dream}. You can cast the spell without expending a spell slot, but once cast, you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aegis
entries: As an action, you surround yourself with a swirling shield of fire, ice, or lightning. You gain temporary hit points equal to your psion level + your Intelligence modifier. Creatures that strike you while you have these temporary hit points take {@damage 1d4} damage of the shield type chosen.
Once you use this talent, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Blast
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}
{@bold Casting Time:} 1 Aktion
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} 1 Runde

You can use your mind to create a burst of elemental power, blasting a target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} cold, fire, force or lightning damage.

For each die of cold damage dealt, the creature's movement speed is reduced by 5 feet until the end of their next turn, for each die of fire damage dealt by the original attack, the creature takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the start of its next turn. For each die of lightning damage dealt, an arc of lightning strikes another creature of your choice within 20 feet, dealing {@damage 1d4} lightning damage (multiple arcs may strike the same creature). Damage from these secondary effects don't add any bonuses (such as Empowered Psionics).
You can spend psi points up to your per use limit to add the following modifiers to (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power.
{@bold Amplifed} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} cold, fire, force or lightning damage on a hit for each additional point spent.

{@bold Lasting} {@italic (1 psi point)}: Your Elemental Blast leaves a 5-foot radius sphere of devastation behind where it strikes until the start of your next turn. Creatures that enter this zone for the first time or end their turn in it must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer the secondary effects (slow, burn, arc) of the blast as if they had been hit by it.

{@bold Massive} {@italic (1-3 psi points)}: You unleash a massive blast; rather than making an attack roll, all creatures within a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity Saving throw. On failure, they take the effect as if hit by the Elemental Blast. The size of the cone is doubled for each point up to 3 spent (2 points for 30 feet, 3 points for 60 feet).

{@bold Overcharged} {@italic (0 psi points)}: You take {@damage 1d4} force damage and do not add your proficiency bonus from the attack or spell save DC for your Elemental Blast, but increase the damage it deals by twice your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Emotions
entries: The powers you wield affect your state of mind, empowering you based on how you wield them. When you deal elemental damage, you gain the related mental property until the start of your next turn.

entries.caption: Elemental Emotions Effects
rows: You can add {@damage 1d4} to Wisdom saving throws
You can add {@damage 1d4} to Constitution saving throws
You can add {@damage 1d4} to Dexterity saving throws

entries: If you are specialized in an element, you can instead add {@dice 1d6} to the related saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Penetration
entries: When you use a psionic power or spell that deals cold, fire, or lightning damage, you can expend 1 psi point to make the power ignore resistance to that elemental damage damage type.
If you have a specialization of Psychokinesis, if the target has immunity to the damage type chosen, this instead turns immunity into resistance for that power.
You can spend psi points granted by Psionic Mastery on this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Phasing - Fusion Talent
entries: As you step between planes, you can tap into the Elemental Planes, bringing their power into the material with you. You can use Psychokinetic modifiers on Phase Rift (excluding Massive).
Additionally, whenever you deal damage to an area with a Psychokinesis ability that would include yourself, you can phase yourself out of reality to take no damage from the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Shield
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell fire shield|phb} without expending psi points. Once you cast it this way, you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest, unless you spend 4 Psi Points to cast it again.

optionalfeature.name: Empathy
entries: You can psionically link yourself to other creatures. As a reaction to a creature you can see within 120 feet of you taking damage, you can grant them resistance to the damage taken, but you take psychic damage equal to the damage they take (after resistance). The damage you take cant be reduced or prevented in any way.
Wenn der Schaden dem Ziel einen weiteren negativen Statuseffekt zufügen würde, kannst du wählen, dass dieser Effekt stattdessen dich betrifft.

If you have any form of telepathic bond that allows long distance telepathic communication affecting the creature taking this damage, the range is unlimited and you do not need to be able to see them.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Strike

otherSummary.entry: Requires {@optfeature Psychokinesis Discipline|ktp|Psychokinesis} or {@optfeature Telekinesis Discipline|ktp}

entries: Once per turn, as part of making a weapon attack as part of the Attack action, you can empower a melee weapon you are holding with psionic power. When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can apply Elemental Blast or Telekinetic Force modifiers (you can only select a power you know) to the attack (you can use Psionic Mastery on this). This doesn't deal the base damage of the power, but any added damage causes the additional effects of the power to occur.

Wenn ein Modifikator angewendet wird, der das Ziel zu einem Wirkungsbereich macht, erleidet nur das Ziel den Waffenschaden, aber andere Kreaturen im Radius werden zum Ziel des Angriffs, als ob sie die Macht normal einsetzen würden.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Manipulation
entries: When you gain this feature, you can manipulate energy in minor ways at will. As an action you can cause a light that casts 30 feet of bright light and 30 feet of dim light, cause things you touch to catch fire as if touched by a match, cause small arcs of electricity, freeze or thaw up to 5-foot cube of water. Any ongoing effect you create lasts 1 minute. You can have a number of simultaneous effects active up your Intelligence modifier, after which creating another ends the oldest ongoing effect.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Regrowth
entries: You gain the {@spell cure wounds|phb} for 1 psi point. You can cast it at a higher level by spending additional psi points. You can cast it a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, after which you cannot cast it again until you complete a long rest. When you cast {@spell cure wounds|phb} on a creature, you can use Enhancing Surge on the target creature has a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Enhancement Discipline
entries: Verbesserung ist die Fähigkeit, mit der Natur und den Fähigkeiten einer Kreatur durch deine psionische Kraft zu interagieren.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@optfeature Enhancing Skill|ktp}
{@optfeature Enhancing Surge|ktp}

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Wenn du die Psionik-Disziplin Verstärkung erlernst, kannst du zusätzlich deine Psionik-Eigenschaft nutzen, um die folgenden Zauber gemäß den in der Eigenschaft definierten Regeln zu wirken:

rows: {@spell alter self|phb}, {@spell darkvision|phb}, {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb}, {@spell lesser restoration|phb}
{@spell catnap|xge}, {@spell haste|phb}, {@spell life transference|xge}, {@spell water breathing|phb}

entries: If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at a level equal to the psi points spent.

entries.name: Available Talents
entries: {@optfeature Enhanced Regrowth|ktp}
{@optfeature Metamorphosis|ktp}
{@optfeature Physical Surge|ktp}
{@optfeature Surging Power|ktp}
{@optfeature Trancendent Life|ktp}

optionalfeature.name: Enhancing Skill
entries: Du kannst deine Psioniker fokussieren, um deine Fähigkeiten zu verbessern. Immer wenn du eine Fertigkeitsprüfung mit Stärke oder Geschicklichkeit durchführst, kannst du 1d4 zu dem Ergebnis addieren.

optionalfeature.name: Enhancing Surge
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}
{@bold Casting Time:} 1 Aktion
{@bold Range:} 60 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} 1 Runde

Du belebst den Körper einer Zielkreatur, die du sehen kannst, mit deiner Psionik. Das Ziel erhält 1d6 temporäre Trefferpunkte, und wenn das Ziel das nächste Mal Schaden zufügt, fügt es 1d6 zusätzlichen Schaden zu einer Anwendung dieses Schadenswurfs zu. Alle verbleibenden Effekte dieses Zaubers enden zu Beginn deines nächsten Zuges.

Du kannst Psi-Punkte bis zu deinem Nutzungslimit ausgeben, um die folgenden Modifikatoren zur Verstärkenden Woge hinzuzufügen (du kannst mehrere Modifikatoren hinzufügen). Die Punkte müssen bei der Wahl des Ziels der Kraft ausgegeben werden.
{@bold Fortifying} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : Das Ziel erhält zusätzlich +1d6 temporäre Trefferpunkte für jeden ausgegebenen Punkt.
{@bold Resilient} {@italic (3 psi points)} : Das Ziel erhält bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges Widerstand gegen jeglichen Schaden.
{@bold Savage} {@italic (1+ psi point)} : Der nächste Waffenangriff des Ziels verursacht für jeden ausgegebenen Psi-Punkt zusätzlich +1d6 Schaden.

{@bold Swift} {@italic (2 psi points)} : Das Ziel erhält eine zusätzliche Aktion. Diese Aktion kann nur verwendet werden, um die Aktion "Hetzen", "Abhauen", "Verstecken" oder "Gegenstand benutzen" auszuführen.

optionalfeature.name: Flicker Step
entries: On your turn, you can replace your movement by teleporting 5 feet in any direction to a space you can see. You can pass through creatures but can't pass through objects, buildings or terrain more than 4 inches thick. This distance increases by 5 feet at 5th level (to 10 feet), at 11th level (to 15 feet), and becomes equal to your speed at 17th level. This replaces all movement for your turn when used.

optionalfeature.name: Flickering Escape
entries: Whenever you roll a d4 for {@spell flicker|ktp}, you can teleport 5 feet after the attack resolves.

optionalfeature.name: Glimpsed Future
entries: When you use Seeing with yourself as the beneficiary, you can use it as a bonus action. When you use Seeing as a bonus action in this way, it doesn't grant additional damage to the attack, or reduce damage taken when hit.

optionalfeature.name: Iron Templar
entries: You gain proficiency with medium armor and shields. If you already have proficiency with medium armor, you gain proficiency with heavy armor. You can perform somatic components for psionic powers with a hand carrying a weapon.
Additionally, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack or with a spell attack with a range of touch, you can use your Denial power as a bonus action targeting that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Mastery - Fusion Talent
entries: Your ability to manipulate energy becomes a single blended prowess, freely swapping between manipulating force and energy. You can apply Telekinetic Force modifiers to Kinetic Blast and Elemental Blast modifiers to Telekinetic Force (though to do not gain any benefits from from a Specialization while doing so).

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Slam
entries: Wenn du die telekinetische Kraft einsetzt, kannst du sie in Form eines kinetischen Energiestoßes entfesseln. Du kannst deine Kraft wie einen psionischen Fernkampfangriff einsetzen (mit Schaden und Effekt bei Treffer). Du kannst nur den Modifikator Hämmern wählen, wenn du sie auf diese Weise einsetzt.

optionalfeature.name: Life Link
entries: Wenn du die telekinetische Kraft einsetzt, kannst du sie in Form eines kinetischen Energiestoßes entfesseln. Du kannst deine Kraft wie einen psionischen Fernkampfangriff einsetzen (mit Schaden und Effekt bei Treffer). Du kannst nur den Modifikator Hämmern wählen, wenn du sie auf diese Weise einsetzt.

optionalfeature.name: Life Wielder

otherSummary.entry: Requires {@optfeature Enhancement Discipline|ktp|Enhancement} or {@optfeature Consumption Discipline|ktp}

entries: You learn the spell {@spell invest life|ktp}. You can spend Psionic Mastery points to cast this spell.

optionalfeature.name: Lingering Rifts
entries: When you use Phase Rift you can choose to leave a 5 foot wide tear in reality behind, forming a line between your starting location and ending location until the start of your next turn. Any creature that enters this area for the first time or ends their turn in it must make a saving throw against the effect of Phase Rift as if it passed through them. If a creature is in the area of multiple lingering rifts, they are affected only once.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Anathema
entries: You gain resistance to damage dealt by spells or magical effects. The effect of all magical healing effects (including healing potions) on you is halved.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Manifested Emotions
entries: You can manifest your emotions into elemental powers that take physical shape. While you are in an elemental emotion, you can expend 2 psi points to manifest that emotion into the world as a bonus action; this takes the form of a mephit (ice mephit for cold, magma mephit for fire, and dust mephit for lightning).

As your emotion, given form, it acts immediately after your initiative at your directive. If not destroyed, it lasts for up to 1 minute, after which it naturally fades away. You can't manifest more than one emotion at a time, and if it is destroyed, you take 2d6 psychic damage from the backlash. This manifestation is not a sentient creature of its own, but simply a manifestation of your emotion.

entries.name: Emotional Actions
entries: There are no mechanical limitations on the actions of the manifested emotion, but it is recommended you consider the emotion from which it is manifest when determining its actions. Magma mephits will act rashly and aggressively, dust mephits will be restless and easily distracted, and ice mephits will be cold and calculating.

optionalfeature.name: Matter Made Real
entries: You gain the ability to solidify some of your projections into real objects, you can cast {@spell fabricate|phb} and {@spell wall of stone|phb} expending psi points equal to the spell level.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Image
entries: You gain the ability to turn your {@optfeature Telepathy Discipline|ktp|telepathy} to project images into the minds of creatures with perfect clarity, interposing it over their reality. The spells {@spell silent image|phb}, {@spell major image|phb}, {@spell hallucinatory terrain|phb}, and {@spell seeming|phb} are added to your Telepathic Discipline Alternate Effects list costing psi points equal to their spell level.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Influence
entries: You specialize in the subtle touch, picking stray thoughts and soothing concerns without overtly intruding upon a mind. You gain expertise in the Persuasion skill, though you are reduced to normal proficiency against creatures that are immune to mental influence or {@condition charmed|charm} (such a creature under the effect of {@spell mind blank|phb}).

optionalfeature.name: Mental Might
entries: Mental Might (Prerequisite: 5th-level Psion) You learn to focus your mental grip. You can use your Intelligence modifier instead of other ability modifiers when you make an Athletics check.

Additionally, you may attempt to grapple or shove a creature within 30 feet, using your mind. When grappling a creature in this way, you can't move them. Maintaining a grapple at a range greater than your natural reach requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell, and the grapple ends if concentration is lost.

optionalfeature.name: Metamorphosis
entries: The {@spell mutate|ktp} and {@spell polymorph|phb} spells are added to your Enhancement Alternate Effects list. You can only target yourself when casting {@spell polymorph|phb} this way.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Devourer
entries: You gain the ability to cast {@spell psychic drain|ktp} for 2 psi points. Additionally, whenever a creature within 10 feet of you that had an Intelligence score of 6 or higher dies, you can expend your reaction to draw in its psionic power, regaining {@damage 1d4} hit points and 1 expended psi point.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Leech
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}
{@bold Casting Time:} 1 Aktion
{@bold Range:} 30 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} Unmittelbar

You assault the mind of a target you can see within range, rending and devouring its psionic energy. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage. If the target is {@condition frightened}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition restrained}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition paralyzed}, the psychic damage becomes {@damage 1d12} instead. On a failed save, you gain a psionic charge of consumed power until the end of your next turn. You can expend this charge when you deal damage to deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, or consume this charge at the end of your turn to gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. You can spend only one charge at a time.
You can target the corpse of a recently perished creature with this power, as long as the target has died within the last minute and not been previously leeched by this power.
{@bold Devouring} {@italic (2 psi points)}: The range of Mind Leech becomes a radius of 5 feet, centered on you.
{@bold Nourishing} {@italic (1 psi point)}: On a failed saving throw, you gain an additional psionic charge.

{@bold Rending} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: The target takes an additional die of damage ({@damage 1d6} or {@damage 1d12} as applicable if they under the effect of a listed condition) per psi point spent on a failed save.
{@bold Shredding} {@italic (1 psi point)}: You leave the targets mind and soul shredded, reducing their next saving throw before the end of your next turn by {@dice 1d4}.

{@bold Stunning} {@italic (3 psi points)}: On a failed saving throw, the target becomes {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. If the power effects multiple targets, select one target for this effect

{@bold Thieving} {@italic (1 psi point)}: On a failed saving throw, you can draw from the target's mind a 5th level or lower spell it can cast (from a Spellcasting or Psionics feature). You must be aware that it can cast that spell; the target retains the ability to cast the spell, but you gain the ability to cast the spell using your Psionics feature by spending psi points equal to the level of the spell (restricted by your psi point limit; you cannot use psionic mastery to cast this spell).

You can know one spell in this manner at a time, and retain the ability to cast the spell for 1 minute or until cast. If the spell is one that restores hit points, you reduce your own hit points by the amount healed by the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Rider
entries: As an action, you can touch a willing creature to see through its eyes and hear what it hears for the next hour, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the creature has.

During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses. You can end this effect at any time. While this is active, the creature has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Nullification Discipline
entries: Nullification is the ability to interfere with the supernatural effects of the world, reverting reality back to its original state.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@optfeature Disruptive Touch|ktp}
{@optfeature Denial|ktp}

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Nullification psionic discipline you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at a level equal to the psi points spent.

entries.name: Available Talents
entries: {@optfeature Deadspot|ktp}
{@optfeature Iron Templar|ktp}
{@optfeature Magical Anathema|ktp}
{@optfeature Magical Resistance|ktp}

optionalfeature.name: One Step Ahead
entries: When you are subjected to a saving throw, you can expend 1 psi point and glimpse into the future. You know what the effect you are saving against is if it is a spell or psionic effect as if you passed an Intelligence (Arcana) or Intelligence (Psionics) check to identify it. Additionally you can add your Intelligence modifier to your saving throw against it regardless of its nature.

optionalfeature.name: Parasitic Nightmare - Fusion Talent
entries: You gain the ability to add Telepathic Intrusion modifiers to Mind Leech.

Additionally, when you deal psychic damage to a creature that is {@condition frightened} of you, you can render yourself {@condition invisible} to that creature until the start of your next turn; you can immediately (no action required) roll an Intelligence (Stealth) check affecting only creatures you are invisible from as a result of this talent.

If you are hidden from a creature that is {@condition frightened} of you, when it moves, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that creature (at the completion of their movement).

optionalfeature.name: Perfect Focus
entries: You can enter a state of extreme focus. Your concentration is no longer interrupted by using a second ability that requires concentration, but your speed is reduced to 0 while concentrating on more than one effect; you have a -5 penalty to any Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration. If you move or fail a save to maintain concentration, one of the spells you are concentrating on ends. If you fail the saving throw to maintain concentration by 5 or more, you lose concentration on both spells.

optionalfeature.name: Personal Truth
entries: Your power of conviction allows you to believe what you choose to. If you spend at least one minute convincing yourself of something—no matter how absurd—spells and effects to determine if you are telling the truth will register that you believe what you have convinced yourself of.
Additionally, your psionic powers allow you to impose your will upon reality to a certain extent. When you expend 1 psi point, you can perform a minor alteration to reality:

items: You can conjure any Tiny object you can imagine that is worth 1 sp or less. This creates an object as you envision it, but doesn't grant you knowledge you do not otherwise have (for example, you would be unable to conjure a key to a lock unless you had a perfect mental image of the correct key).
As an action, you can change the color or taste of a Small or smaller object with 10 feet. This change lasts for 1 minute.
As a reaction to a creature within 30 feet taking damage (including yourself), you can change the damage type they take.

optionalfeature.name: Phantom Blade Barrage - Fusion Talent

feature: Psionic Synthesis, Projected Weaponry, Telekinetic Weapons

entries: You can create a weapon with Projected Weapon as part of making an attack with it using Telekinetic Weapons, allowing you to project as many weapons in this manner as you make attacks (no additional action required). When you use weapons created by Projected Weaponry as the projectiles for your Telekinetic Weapons, the range you can fling the weapons is doubled.

Additionally, if you expend 6 psi points on the Whirling modifier of Telekinetic Weapons, you can cast {@spell blade barrier|phb} instead of {@spell cloud of daggers|phb}, generating a much larger number of ethereal blades as part of the casting.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Rift
entries: {@italic Psionic Power}
{@bold Casting Time:} 1 Aktion
{@bold Range:} 10 feet
{@bold Components:} S
{@bold Duration:} 1 Runde

You step through space traveling up to 10 feet in a straight line, leaving a spacial tear behind. You can pass through creatures but can't pass through objects, buildings or terrain more than 4 inches thick. Any creature in the path of this tear must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} force damage.

Du kannst Psi-Punkte bis zu deinem Nutzungslimit ausgeben, um Phase Rift die folgenden Modifikatoren hinzuzufügen (du kannst mehrere Modifikatoren hinzufügen). Die Punkte müssen bei der Wahl des Ziels der Kraft ausgegeben werden.

{@bold Blurring} {@italic (1-3 psi points)}: You gain an illusory duplicate, as per the {@spell mirror image|phb} spell. You gain 1 duplicate per psi point spent (up to a maximum of 3). One remaining image fades at the start of each of your turns.
{@bold Disruptive} {@italic (1+ psi points)}: Each target that fails their saving throw takes an additional {@damage 1d8} force damage for each point spent.
{@bold Echoing} {@italic (2 psi points)}: You immediately use Phase Rift again with the same action.

{@bold Ethereal} {@italic (2 psi points)}: You can pass through solid objects, buildings, and terrain as long as you end your Phase Rift in a space you can occupy. If your Phase Rift would end inside a space you can't occupy, the power fails.
{@bold Long} {@italic (1-3 psi points)}: You can travel an additional 10 feet for each point spent.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Shot
entries: You can use your {@optfeature Phase Rift|ktp} power, you can instead empower a piece of ammunition you touch, granting it the following special properties when you fire it:

items: It can be fired through all cover, including total cover, that is less than 4 inches thick.
It deals {@damage 1d8} additional force damage.

entries: Additionally, applying Phase Rift modifiers grant special effects on this attack:

items: {@b Disruptive:} The attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage on hit.
{@b Blurring:} You can roll an additional attack roll per psi point spent, selecting the highest roll.
{@b Long:} The effective range of the attack is increased by 10 feet per point spent.
{@b Echoing:} A second projectile is created on firing, using a separate attack roll. (You may target any creature in range with this attack, including the same creature)
{@b Ethereal:} The attack can travel through up to 10 feet of cover

optionalfeature.name: Phase Shroud
entries: After using Phase Rift, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + the psi points spent on the power.

optionalfeature.name: Phase Slash
entries: You can expend 1 psi point to make a single melee weapon attack against any targets you pass through with Phase Rift as part of the same action. You must spend 1 psi point per creature attacked this way. You can make this attack against a target once per turn. You can spend Psionic Mastery points on this talent.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Surge
entries: Wenn du Verstärkende Welle auf dich selbst anwendest, kannst du bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges wählen, ob du deine Stärke- oder Geschicklichkeits-Fähigkeitspunkte gleich deinem Intelligenz-Modifikator-Fähigkeitswert machen willst.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Telekinesis - Fusion Talent
entries: When you use an Enhancing Surge to empower a creature, you can expend a psi point to augment it with your Telekinesis to further assist them, optionally granting one of the following benefits:

items: You can move the creature 10 feet (this movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks).
You can telekinetically deflect the first weapon attack against them before the start of your next turn, giving that attack disadvantage.
You can telekinetically boost their next Strength (Athletics) check or weapon attack before the start of your next turn, granting that check or attack advantage.

entries: Addititionally, while under the effect of Enhancing Surge, the amount you can lift, drag, or carry is doubled with assistance of your telekinesis, and you can apply Telekinetic Force modifiers to your weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Psionics
entries: When a target passes the saving throw against a damaging Psionic Power (granted by a psionic discipline), they still take half damage, but suffer no other effects.

optionalfeature.name: Precise Power
entries: The {@spell Dancing Objects (Animate Object)|KibblesTasty:CC} spell is added to your Telekinesis Alternate Effects list, which you can cast expending 5 psi points. Additionally, as a reaction to a ranged weapon attack you can see being made against a target within 60 feet of you, you can expend 1 psi point to add or subtract 2d4 to or from that attack roll. You can do this after the attack is rolled, but before you know the outcome of the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Precognition Discipline
entries: Precognition is the ability to see what lies ahead, piercing the veil of the future. Seeing things that most people cannot a Psion with Precognitive abilites can, to a limited extent, know the future; such a future is known by tracing its roots from the present, and grows more mysterious and cloudy as such roots grow distant.

Such a future can be changed by the actions of the present, particularly by knowledge of said future and action to prevent or change it. This is the function most often leveraged by Precognitive Psions, peering into the future to steer around courses they seek to prevent or steer toward a possible outcome they seek.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@optfeature Prescience|ktp}
{@optfeature Seeing|ktp}

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Precognition psionic discipline you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:

rows: {@spell detect evil and good|phb}, {@spell future insight|ktp}

entries: {@spell Augury|phb} has the same effect, but doesn't consult a specific entity when cast in this way.
{@spell Death ward|phb} has the same effect, but gives a forewarning to a creature allowing them to avoid death when cast in this way.
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at a level equal to the psi points spent.

entries.name: Available Talents
entries: {@optfeature Glimpsed Future|ktp}
{@optfeature One Step Ahead|ktp}
{@optfeature Precognitive Dreams|ktp}

optionalfeature.name: Precognitive Dreams
entries: When you finish a long rest, your dreams have prepared you for the day to come. Upon waking, you issue reassuring words and advice to your companions to help them survive the day, giving them temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. During the next 24 hours, you can't be surprised.

optionalfeature.name: Prescience
entries: Your eyes wander to events before they happen. You can add your proficiency to Perception and initiative rolls; if you already are able to add your proficiency to Perception, you can add twice your proficiency.

If you concentrate on keeping an eye on the future (as if concentrating on a spell), you can use your Intelligence modifier for Wisdom (Perception) checks (instead of Wisdom) and initiative rolls (instead of Dexterity), and you make Intelligence saving throws in place of Dexterity saving throws. You can initiate this concentration at any time.

optionalfeature.name: Project Item
entries: As an action, you can use your powers to project an inanimate object you imagine into your hands. It can't be larger than 3 feet on any side or weigh more than 10 pounds, and is clearly ethereal in nature. The item behaves as a solid object. Weapons created with this feature deal force damage.
Die projizierten Elemente werden nach 1 Minute ausgeblendet, und Sie können nicht mehr als 3 projizierte Elemente gleichzeitig haben.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Nightmares
entries: Du erhältst eine zusätzliche Option für Grenzenlose Vorstellungskraft, die du auf dein Astralkonstrukt anwenden kannst:

items: {@b Horrifying Nightmare}: Creatures of your choice that start their turn within 5 feet of your Astral Construct must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Psionics DC or become frightened of your Astral Construct until the start of their next turn. On a successful save, they are immune to the effect for the next 24 hours or until you summon a new Astral Construct.

optionalfeature.name: Projected Weaponry
entries: When you project a weapon with your Project Item feature, it gains the following benefits:

items: You can project it as a bonus action and you can project up 3 weapons or pieces of ammunition at the same time.
You are proficient with any projected weapon.
It is no longer restricted to a maximum of 3 feet when it takes the form of a weapon (for a Medium-sized creature).
You can use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for attack and damage rolls with it.
If it has the thrown property, its throwing range is doubled. If it doesn't have the thrown property, it gains the thrown (10/30) property.
You can apply the Astral Construct modifiers Grow and Sustain to Projected Weaponry. Grow adds 1d8 to the weapon's damage dice. You can expend Psionic Mastery on these modifiers.

optionalfeature.name: Projection Discipline
entries: Projektion ist die Fähigkeit, das, was in deinem Kopf ist, mit deiner psionischen Kraft in die Außenwelt zu projizieren.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@optfeature Project Item|ktp}
{@optfeature Astral Construct|ktp}

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Projection psionic discipline, you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at a level equal to the psi points spent.

entries.name: Available Talents
entries: {@optfeature Animated Projections|ktp}
{@optfeature Astral Swap|ktp}
{@optfeature Life Link|ktp}
{@optfeature Matter Made Real|ktp}
{@optfeature Projected Weaponry|ktp}
{@optfeature Unlimited Imagination|ktp}

optionalfeature.name: Propelled Bound

otherSummary.entry: Requires {@optfeature Telekinesis Discipline|ktp|Telekinesis} or {@optfeature Psychokinesis Discipline|ktp}

entries: When you move on your turn, you can expend movement, up to your speed, in single bounding leap, propelled by telekinetic power or psychokinetic force.

optionalfeature.name: Psi Crystal
entries: You gain the ability to impart part of your mind into crystal. You can expend 2 psi points to cast the {@spell find familiar|phb} spell, but your familiar takes on the statistics of a {@creature psi crystal|ktp} and the material component required is a crystal worth 10 gp instead of the normal material components. The {@creature psi crystal|ktp} gains your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You can use Psionic Disciplines with a range greater than self through your Psi Crystal is if you were standing in its location. If your {@creature psi crystal|ktp} is destroyed, you gain its memories as your own. While you have a {@creature psi crystal|ktp} active, as a bonus action, you can deactivate it to regain 2 expended psi points.

When you summon a {@creature psi crystal|ktp}, you can store a fragment of your personality, that you can then release by shattering the crystal. Select one of the following when summoning a psi crystal:

items: {@b Courage}: When you make a saving throw against the {@condition frightened} condition, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing that emotion to gain advantage on the save.

{@b Cowardice}: When your Psi Crystal is within 30 of you and a creature comes within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing that emotion and immediately moving up to your speed away from the creature without taking an attack of opportunity.

{@b Cruelty}: When your Psi Crystal is within 30 feet of a creature that takes damage, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing that emotion and causing the creature take additional damage equal to your Psion level.

{@b Sympathy}: When your Psi crystal is within 30 feet of you and another creature, if that creature takes damage, you can use your reaction to shatter the crystal, releasing that emotion and granting the creature resistance to that damage. You take an equal amount of damage to the damage they take.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Defenses
entries: Du erhältst eine Möglichkeit, dich mit deinen psionischen Kräften zu verteidigen. Solange du keine Rüstung oder einen Schild trägst, ist deine Rüstungsklasse gleich 13 + dein Intelligenzmodifikator.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 psi point to imbue a weapon you are holding with psionic energy. For 1 minute, once per turn when you deal damage with that weapon, you can deal an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage.

At higher levels you can expend additional psi points to further enhance the Psionic weapon; 2 points to enhance it {@damage 2d6} at 5th level, 3 points to enhance it to {@damage 3d6} at 11th level, and 4 points to enhance it to {@damage 4d6} at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Psychokinesis Discipline
entries: Psychokinesis is the mental art of spontaneously creating and controlling energy; sapping energy to freeze or spontaneously creating it create bursts of fire or arcs of lightning. Dangerous and destructive, it provides devestating power.

entries.name: Features
entries: {@optfeature Energy Manipulation|ktp}
{@optfeature Elemental Blast|ktp}

entries.name: Alternate Effects
entries: Additionally, when you learn the Psychokinesis psionic discipline you can use your Psionics feature to cast the following spells as per the rules defined in the feature:
If a spell can be cast at a higher level, you can spend additional psi points to cast it at a level equal to the psi points spent.

entries.name: Specializations
entries: Wenn du diese Disziplin erlernst, kannst du eine Spezialisierung aus der folgenden Liste wählen (musst aber nicht). Du kannst nur eine Spezialisierung wählen, wenn du die Disziplin erlangst, und kannst eine einmal gewählte Spezialisierung nicht ändern oder entfernen.

entries.name: Cryokinetic
entries: You can only deal cold damage with Elemental Blast. When a creature is hit by an attack of your Elemental Blast or fails a saving throw against this power, it becomes frozen until the end of its next turn, giving it disadvantage on its next attack roll or Dexterity saving throw, and reducing its speed by an additional 5 feet (to a total of 10 feet).
Wenn der Angriffswurf ein kritischer Treffer ist oder das Ziel seinen Rettungswurf um 5 oder mehr verfehlt, wird das Ziel gefesselt und eingefroren.
The following list of spells replace your Alternate Effects list:

entries.name: Electrokinetic
entries: You can only deal Lightning damage with Elemental Blast, but the size of the damage dice of lightning damage (both the initial damage and arc damage ) is increased by one step (to {@damage 1d10} initial damage and {@damage 1d10} additional damage per point spent on Amplified, and {@damage 1d6} arc damage to a nearby target per die of initial damage).
The following list of spells replace your Alternate Effects list:

entries.name: Pyrokinetic
entries: You can only deal fire damage with Elemental Blast, but the size of the damage dice of fire damage (both the initial damage and burn damage) is increased by one step (to {@damage 1d10} initial damage and {@damage 1d10} additional damage per point spent on Amplified, and {@damage 1d6} burn damage at the start of their turn per die of initial damage).
The following list of spells replace your Alternate Effects list:

entries.name: Available Talents
entries: {@optfeature Elemental Aegis|ktp}
{@optfeature Elemental Emotions|ktp}
{@optfeature Elemental Shield|ktp}
{@optfeature Manifested Emotions|ktp}

optionalfeature.name: Reality Warper - Fusion Talent

feature: Psionic Synthesis, Matter Made Real, Mental Image

entries: You can bring the illusions you make people see to life. When you are concentrating on an illusion spell, as a bonus action you can expend psi points during your turn to bring aspects of the illusion into reality. For each psi point spent you can bring a 5-foot-cube section of the illusion into reality until the start of your next turn, and it can have the following effects:

items: If the effect would do damage, each 5-foot cube can damage one target. That target must pass a Dexterity saving throw, or take damage equal to a number of d8 dice equal to the level of the spell.

If the effect would stop a creature, they can't move through it. If the effect would restrain a creature, that creature must pass a Dexterity saving throw or become restrained until the start of your next turn.
Each 5-foot cube can affect only one creature that is either within it or adjacent to it. The GM may allow other effects at their discretion.

optionalfeature.name: Reflected Agony
entries: When a creature within 120 feet that you can see deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to spend 1 or more psi points (up to your psi limit) to share the pain you experienced back at them, dealing {@damage 1d10} psychic damage per point spent. The damage this deals can't exceed the damage taken from the attack.

optionalfeature.name: Rift Strike
entries: When you use your Phase Rift power as an action, you can make a single weapon attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Schism
entries: You can spend 1 psi point to temporarily divide your mind to do two things at once until the end of your turn.
